pages.text: §oDown to brass tacks.§r Combining copper and zinc gives an important new material - brass. Brass is strong while also being easy to machine. It is also quite conductive and ductile. A jack of all trades, master of none kind of alloy if you will. Initially, brass can be created by mixing $(item)Copper Powder$() and $(item)Zinc Powder$() to give $(item)Brass Powder$() that is then smelted into $(item)Brass Ingots$().
